summary: Albany is the capital and oldest city in New York state, located on the Hudson River. It was first settled by Dutch colonists and later taken over by the English, who named it after the Duke of Albany. The city has a rich history in trade and transportation, being a hub for railroads and the Erie Canal. Albany became the state capital in 1797. Today, it has a population of over 100,000 and is known for its high-tech industry, especially nanotechnology. The city has also experienced urban renewal projects to revitalize its downtown area.
title: Albany, New York
